architectural_decisions.title: Use Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure a scalable, maintainable, and secure system.

architectural_decisions.title: Employ Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access layer and provide methods for CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Implement Dependency Injection
architectural_decisions.rationale: To manage dependencies, such as the current user and the payment processor.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle various error scenarios using FastAPI's HTTPException.

architectural_decisions.title: Support Multiple Payment Providers
architectural_decisions.rationale: To enable flexibility in payment processing.

architectural_decisions.title: Use JWT Tokens for Authentication
architectural_decisions.rationale: To securely authenticate users and enforce authorization.

architectural_decisions.title: Implement ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract database operations and facilitate easier maintenance.

architectural_decisions.title: Send Order Confirmation Emails
architectural_decisions.rationale: To notify customers about successfully placed orders.

components.name: orders
components.description: Provides REST API endpoints for order management.

components.name: processor
components.description: Handles payment processing for the e-commerce API.

Create a New Order.description: This endpoint allows users to create a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.

steps.description: Send a POST request to /api/orders/create with a JSON body containing order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Verify the response status code. Return a successful order creation if the status code is 201 Created; otherwise, handle errors according to the error handling section.

Get Order Details.description: This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific order by its ID. Users can only access their own orders.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/orders/{order_id}, replacing {order_id} with the actual order ID you want to retrieve.
Verify the response status code. Return the order details if the status code is 200 OK; otherwise, handle errors according to the error handling section.

List User Orders.description: This endpoint lists all orders for the current user, supporting pagination via limit and offset parameters.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/orders/, optionally including query parameters for pagination such as limit and offset.
Verify the response status code. Return the list of orders if the status code is 200 OK; otherwise, handle errors according to the error handling section.

Cancel an Order.description: This endpoint allows users to cancel a pending order. Orders that are processing or shipped cannot be cancelled.

steps.description: Send a POST request to /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel, replacing {order_id} with the actual order ID you want to cancel.
Verify the response status code. Return a cancellation success message if the status code is 200 OK; otherwise, handle errors according to the error handling section.
